00044 void find_data(const std::string& file_name,
00045                const std::string& tsv_name,
00046                const std::string& col_name,
00047                const std::string& val)
00048 {
00049   //
00050   affx::File5_File* file5=new affx::File5_File();
00051   file5->open(file_name,affx::FILE5_OPEN);
00052   affx::File5_Tsv* tsv5;
00053   tsv5=file5->openTsv(tsv_name,affx::FILE5_OPEN);
00054 
00055   // print the header
00056   tsv5->printfHeader();
00057   if (tsv5->findFirst(0,col_name,val)==affx::FILE5_OK) {
00058     tsv5->printfRow();
00059   }
00060 
00061   //
00062   tsv5->close();
00063   delete tsv5;
00064   file5->close();
00065   delete file5;
00066 }

00084 /////
00085 
00086 void TsvToTsv5_convert(const std::string& file_in,
00087                        const std::string& file_out,
00088                        const std::string& tsv_name,
00089                        bool copymetadata,
00090                        bool append)
00091 {
00092   printf("### tsv_to_tsv5: '%s' to '%s:%s'...\n",
00093          file_in.c_str(),
00094          file_out.c_str(),tsv_name.c_str());
00095   //
00096   affx::TsvFile* tsv_in=new affx::TsvFile();
00097   tsv_in->open(file_in);
00098 
00099   //
00100   affx::File5_File* file5=new affx::File5_File();
00101   if(append) {
00102     file5->open(file_out,affx::FILE5_OPEN|affx::FILE5_CREATE);
00103   } else {
00104     file5->open(file_out,affx::FILE5_REPLACE);
00105   }
00106   if (!file5->is_open()) {
00107     Err::errAbort("Cant open '"+file_out+"'");
00108   }
00109 
00110   //
00111   affx::File5_Tsv* tsv5_out;
00112   tsv5_out=file5->openTsv(tsv_name,affx::FILE5_REPLACE);
00113 
00114   //
00115   TsvToTsv5_copy_schema(tsv_in,tsv5_out);
00116   if (copymetadata) {
00117     TsvToTsv5_copy_metadata(tsv_in,tsv5_out);
00118   }
00119   TsvToTsv5_copy_data(tsv_in,tsv5_out);
00120 
00121   //
00122   tsv5_out->close();
00123   delete tsv5_out;
00124   // force a core dump after tsv5_out is closed...
00125   // Any rechable allocations we see should be as a result of it.
00126   // assert(0);
00127   file5->close();
00128   delete file5;
00129   //
00130   tsv_in->close();
00131   delete tsv_in;
00132 }
00133 
00134 void TsvToTsv5_copy_schema(affx::TsvFile* tsv_in,affx::File5_Tsv* tsv5_out)
00135 {
00136   // Figure out what the types of the Tsv5 columns should be.
00137   //if (tsv_in->deduce_types()!=affx::TSV_OK) {
00138   //  Err::errAbort("Unable to deduce_types for '"+tsv_in->getFileName()+"'");
00139   //}
00140   // what are the maximum lengths of the columns?
00141   //tsv_in->deduce_sizes();
00142 
00143   // do the deductions first.
00144   tsv_in->deduce_types();
00145   tsv_in->deduce_sizes();
00146 
00147   std::string key;
00148   std::string val_str;
00149   int val_int;
00150   //
00151   affx::TsvFileField* col;
00152   std::string col_name;
00153   affx::tsv_type_t col_type;
00154   affx::File5_dtype_t col_dtype;
00155   int col_max_size;
00156 
00157   // create the columns
00158   int clvl_max=tsv_in->getLevelCount();
00159   for (int clvl=0;clvl<clvl_max;clvl++) {
00160     int cidx_max=tsv_in->getColumnCount(clvl);
00161     for (int cidx=0;cidx<cidx_max;cidx++) {
00162       // grab a ref to this column
00163       col=tsv_in->clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cidx);
00164       APT_ERR_ASSERT(col!=NULL,"internal error.");
00165       col_name=col->get_name();
00166       // start with what we guessed.
00167       col_type=col->get_type();
00168       // look to see if there is a header which declares the type.
00169       key=FILE5_TSVMETA_PREFIX"-"+ToStr(clvl)+"-"+ToStr(cidx);
00170       if (tsv_in->getHeader(key+"-type",val_str)==affx::TSV_OK) {
00171         col_type=affx::TsvFile::stringToColType(val_str);
00172         APT_ERR_ASSERT(col_type!=affx::TSV_TYPE_ERR,"unknown TsvFile type.");
00173       }
00174       if (tsv_in->getHeader(key+"-len",val_int)==affx::TSV_OK) {
00175         col->m_max_size=val_int;
00176       }
00177       //
00178       col_dtype=affx::as_file5_dtype(col_type);
00179       col_max_size=col->get_max_size();
00180       //
00181       //printf("col: %d: %d: type=%2d max_size=%d name='%s'\n",clvl,cidx,col_dtype,col_max_size,col_name.c_str());
00182       //
00183       tsv5_out->defineColumn(clvl,cidx,col_name,col_dtype,col_max_size);
00184     }
00185   }
00186   // did we define the Tsv5 columns correctly?
00187   // tsv5_out->dump();
00188 }
00189 
00190 void TsvToTsv5_copy_metadata(affx::TsvFile* tsv_in,affx::File5_Tsv* tsv5_out)
00191 {
00192   std::string key;
00193   std::string val;
00194 
00195   tsv_in->headersBegin();
00196   while (tsv_in->headersNext(key,val)==affx::TSV_OK) {
00197     // not a meta prefix?
00198     if (key.find(FILE5_TSVMETA_PREFIX)!=0) {
00199       tsv5_out->addHeader(key,val);
00200     }
00201   }
00202 }
00203 
00204 void TsvToTsv5_copy_data(affx::TsvFile* tsv_in,affx::File5_Tsv* tsv5_out)
00205 {
00206   // Now that the columns are defined
00207   int clvl;
00208   while (tsv_in->nextLine()==affx::TSV_OK) {
00209     clvl=tsv_in->lineLevel();
00210     if (clvl<0) {
00211       continue;
00212     }
00213     //
00214     //printf(" %3d:",clvl);
00215     //
00216     for (int cidx=0;cidx<tsv_in->getColumnCount(clvl);cidx++) {
00217       std::string val;
00218       tsv_in->get(clvl,cidx,val);
00219       //printf(" '%s' ",val.c_str());
00220       //
00221       int val_i;
00222       float val_f;
00223       double val_d;
00224       std::string val_string;
00225 
00226       affx::File5_TsvColumn* col_ptr=tsv5_out->getColumnPtr(clvl,cidx);
00227       assert(col_ptr!=NULL);
00228       affx::File5_dtype_t dtype=col_ptr->m_dtype;
00229 
00230       switch (dtype) {
00231       case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_CHAR:
00232       case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_SHORT:
00233       case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_INT:
00234         tsv_in->get(clvl,cidx,val_i);
00235         tsv5_out->set_i(clvl,cidx,val_i);
00236         break;
00237         //
00238       case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_FLOAT:
00239         tsv_in->get(clvl,cidx,val_f);
00240         tsv5_out->set_f(clvl,cidx,val_f);
00241         break;
00242       case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE:
00243         tsv_in->get(clvl,cidx,val_d);
00244         tsv5_out->set_d(clvl,cidx,val_d);
00245         break;
00246         //
00247       case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_STRING:
00248         tsv_in->get(clvl,cidx,val_string);
00249         tsv5_out->set_string(clvl,cidx,val_string);
00250         break;
00251       default:
00252         Err::errAbort("dtype.");
00253         assert(0);
00254       }
00255     }
00256     //printf("\n");
00257     tsv5_out->writeLevel(clvl);
00258   }
00259 
00260   printf("### converted %d rows.\n",tsv_in->lineNum());
00261 }
00262 
00263 //////////
00264 
00265 void Tsv5ToTsv_convert(const std::string& file_in,
00266                        const std::string& internal_name,
00267                        const std::string& file_out,
00268                        int precision)
00269 {
00270   printf("### tsv5_to_tsv: '%s' to '%s'...\n",file_in.c_str(),file_out.c_str());
00271 
00272   //
00273   affx::TsvFile* tsv_out=new affx::TsvFile();
00274   // make sure that escapes are used.
00275   tsv_out->m_optEscapeOk=true;
00276   // and set default precision 
00277   tsv_out->setPrecision(precision);
00278 
00279   //
00280   affx::File5_File* file5=new affx::File5_File();
00281   file5->open(file_in,affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00282   //
00283   affx::File5_Tsv* tsv5_in;
00284   tsv5_in=file5->openTsv(internal_name,affx::FILE5_OPEN);
00285 
00286   // Add a bunch of headers describing the conversion process.
00287   tsv_out->addHeader(FILE5_TSVMETA_PREFIX,"Headers which begin with this prefix are ignored.");
00288   tsv_out->addHeader(FILE5_TSVMETA_PREFIX,"They will be stripped when converted into File5_Tsv objects.");
00289   tsv_out->addHeader(FILE5_TSVMETA_PREFIX"-filename",file_in);
00290   tsv_out->addHeader(FILE5_TSVMETA_PREFIX"-internalname",internal_name);
00291 
00292   Tsv5ToTsv_copy_schema(tsv5_in,tsv_out);
00293   Tsv5ToTsv_copy_metadata(tsv5_in,tsv_out);
00294 
00295   tsv_out->writeTsv(file_out);
00296 
00297   Tsv5ToTsv_copy_data(tsv5_in,tsv_out);
00298 
00299   //
00300   tsv_out->close();
00301   delete tsv_out;
00302   //
00303   tsv5_in->close();
00304   delete tsv5_in;
00305   file5->close();
00306   delete file5;
00307 }
00308 
00309 void Tsv5ToTsv_copy_schema(affx::File5_Tsv* tsv5_in,affx::TsvFile* tsv_out)
00310 {
00311   // create the columns
00312   int clvl_max=tsv5_in->getLevelCount();
00313   for (int clvl=0;clvl<clvl_max;clvl++) {
00314     int cidx_max=tsv5_in->getColumnCount(clvl);
00315     for (int cidx=0;cidx<cidx_max;cidx++) {
00316       //
00317       //affx::File5_TsvColumn* col=tsv5_in->getColumn(clvl,cidx);
00318       //int col_type=col->get_dtype();
00319       //affx::tsv_type_t tsv_ctype=tsv_in.get_type(clvl,cidx);
00320       //affx::File5_dtype_t cdtype=affx::as_file5_dtype(tsv_ctype);
00321       std::string cname;
00322       tsv5_in->getColumnName(clvl,cidx,&cname);
00323       //printf("col: %d: %d: type=%2d name='%s'\n",clvl,cidx,col_type,cname.c_str());
00324       //
00325       tsv_out->defineColumn(clvl,cidx,cname);
00326       //
00327       affx::File5_TsvColumn* col_ptr=tsv5_in->getColumnPtr(clvl,cidx);
00328       affx::File5_dtype_t dtype=col_ptr->m_dtype;
00329       std::string key=FILE5_TSVMETA_PREFIX"-"+ToStr(clvl)+"-"+ToStr(cidx);
00330       tsv_out->addHeader(key+"-type",affx::file5_dtype_to_string(dtype));
00331       if (dtype==affx::FILE5_DTYPE_STRING) {
00332         tsv_out->addHeader(key+"-len",col_ptr->m_dtype_size);
00333       }
00334     }
00335   }
00336 }
00337 
00338 void Tsv5ToTsv_copy_metadata(affx::File5_Tsv* tsv5_in,affx::TsvFile* tsv_out)
00339 {
00340   std::string key;
00341   std::string val;
00342 
00343   tsv5_in->headersBegin();
00344   while (tsv5_in->headersNext(&key,&val)==affx::FILE5_OK) {
00345     // printf ("Tsv5ToTsv: addHeader('%s','%s')\n",key.c_str(),val.c_str());
00346     tsv_out->addHeader(key,val);
00347   }
00348 }
00349 
00350 void Tsv5ToTsv_copy_data(affx::File5_Tsv* tsv5_in,affx::TsvFile* tsv_out)
00351 {
00352   tsv5_in->rewind();
00353 
00354   while (tsv5_in->nextLine()==affx::FILE5_OK) {
00355     int clvl=tsv5_in->lineLevel();
00356     //
00357     for (int cidx=0;cidx<tsv5_in->getColumnCount(clvl);cidx++) {
00358       // copy the correct type of data.
00359       char val_c;
00360       int val_i;
00361       float val_f;
00362       double val_d;
00363       std::string val_s;
00364 
00365       affx::File5_TsvColumn* col_ptr=tsv5_in->getColumnPtr(clvl,cidx);
00366       assert(col_ptr!=NULL);
00367       affx::File5_dtype_t dtype=col_ptr->m_dtype;
00368 
00369       switch (dtype) {
00370       case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_CHAR:
00371         tsv5_in->get(clvl,cidx,&val_c);
00372         tsv_out->set(clvl,cidx,val_c);
00373         break;
00374       case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_SHORT:
00375         tsv5_in->get(clvl,cidx,&val_s);
00376         tsv_out->set(clvl,cidx,val_s);
00377         break;
00378       case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_INT:
00379         tsv5_in->get(clvl,cidx,&val_i);
00380         tsv_out->set(clvl,cidx,val_i);
00381         break;
00382       case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_FLOAT:
00383         tsv5_in->get(clvl,cidx,&val_f);
00384         tsv_out->set(clvl,cidx,val_f);
00385         break;
00386       case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE:
00387         tsv5_in->get(clvl,cidx,&val_d);
00388         tsv_out->set(clvl,cidx,val_d);
00389         break;
00390       case affx::FILE5_DTYPE_STRING:
00391         tsv5_in->get(clvl,cidx,&val_s);
00392         tsv_out->set(clvl,cidx,val_s);
00393         break;
00394       default:
00395         Err::errAbort("Tsv5ToTsv_copy_data: bad type. (dtype="+ToStr(dtype)+")");
00396         assert(0);
00397       }
00398     }
00399     tsv_out->writeLevel(clvl);
00400   }
00401   printf("### converted %d rows\n",tsv5_in->lineNum()+1);
00402 }
00403 
00404 
00405 void generate_test_file(const std::string& file_name,
00406                         int num_rows,
00407                         int num_levels,
00408                         int num_cols_str,
00409                         int num_cols_int,
00410                         int num_cols_double)
00411 {
00412   printf("Creating test file: '%s' (s=%d,i=%d,d=%d)\n",
00413          file_name.c_str(),
00414          num_cols_str,num_cols_int,num_cols_double);
00415   //
00416   affx::TsvFile* tsv_out=new affx::TsvFile();
00417   //
00418   char col_name[100];
00419   int cidx;
00420   //
00421 
00422   for (int clvl=0;clvl<num_levels;clvl++) {
00423     cidx=0;
00424     for (int i=0;i<num_cols_str;i++,cidx++) {
00425       sprintf(col_name,"test-s-%03d-%03d",clvl,cidx);
00426       tsv_out->defineColumn(clvl,cidx,col_name);
00427     }
00428     for (int i=0;i<num_cols_int;i++,cidx++) {
00429       sprintf(col_name,"test-i-%03d-%03d",clvl,cidx);
00430       tsv_out->defineColumn(clvl,cidx,col_name);
00431     }
00432     for (int i=0;i<num_cols_double;i++,cidx++) {
00433       sprintf(col_name,"test-d-%03d-%03d",clvl,cidx);
00434       tsv_out->defineColumn(clvl,cidx,col_name);
00435     }
00436   }
00437 
00438   // add some '#%key=val' headers.
00439   for (int i=0;i<20;i++) {
00440     char key_buf[100];
00441     char val_buf[100];
00442     sprintf(key_buf,"key-%04d",i);
00443     sprintf(val_buf,"val-%04d",i);
00444     tsv_out->addHeader(key_buf,val_buf);
00445   }
00446 
00447   //
00448   tsv_out->writeTsv(file_name);
00449 
00450   //
00451   int val=0;
00452   char val_buf[100];
00453 
00454   for (int i=0;i<num_rows;i++) {
00455     int cidx=0;
00456     int clvl=i%num_levels;
00457     //
00458     for (int i=0;i<num_cols_str;i++,cidx++) {
00459       sprintf(val_buf,"str-%06d",val++);
00460       tsv_out->set(clvl,cidx,val_buf);
00461     }
00462     for (int i=0;i<num_cols_int;i++,cidx++) {
00463       tsv_out->set(clvl,cidx,val++);
00464     }
00465     for (int i=0;i<num_cols_double;i++,cidx++) {
00466       tsv_out->set(clvl,cidx,(val++)+0.01);
00467     }
00468     //
00469     tsv_out->writeLevel(clvl);
00470   }
00471 
00472   //
00473   tsv_out->close();
00474   delete tsv_out;
00475 }
00476 
00477 //////////
00478 
00479 void define_aptfile5util_options(PgOptions* opts)
00480 {
00481   opts->setUsage("apt-file5-util -- A utility for working with APT file5 formats.\n"
00482                  "\n"
00483                  "EXAMPLES:\n"
00484                  "\n"
00485                  "* To convert an A5 TsvReport to text:\n"
00486                  "    apt-file5-util --to-tsv --internal-name CN5/CN5.calls -o calls.txt  calls.a5\n"
00487                  "  You can find the 'internal-name' by running 'h5dump -n' on the A5 file.\n"
00488                  "  The name is the path up to the 'tsv-col-000-000' dataset.\n"
00489                  "\n"
00490                  "* To convert one text tsv file to A5:\n"
00491                  "    apt-file5-util --to-tsv5 --internal-name=CN5/CN5.calls -o calls.a5 calls.txt\n"
00492                  "\n"
00493                  "If you have multiple tsv files which have a 'file5-tsv-meta-internalname',\n"
00494                  "(which is what  --to-tsv will add) then several tsvfiles can be imported\n"
00495                  "at the same time.\n"
00496                  "   apt-file5-util --to-tsv5 -o OUTPUT.a5 *.tsv\n"
00497                  "\n"
00498                  "   Note: you may want to run h5repack -i INPUT.a5 -o OUTPUT.a5 to reclaim space.\n"
00499                  "\n"
00500                  "* To find and print a matching value in an tsv5 dataset:\n"
00501                  "    apt-file5-util -i test9.tsv5 --internal-name test9 --find-col COLNAME --find-val MATCHVAL\n"
00502                  "  The column names can be found by converting the file to text format.\n"
00503                  "\n"
00504                  "NOTE: '--append' isnt the best name.  It appends the data set to an existing HDF5/A5 file.\n"
00505                  "      It does the append by REPLACING the dataset in that location.\n"
00506                  "      If there isnt a dataset by that name, then it really is an append.\n"
00507                  "\n"
00508                  "NOTE: After adding or replacing data in an HDF5/A5 file, there might be some extra space\n"
00509                  "      left unallocated in the file.  To reclaim this space to should run 'h5repack'.\n"
00510                  "      (This should be done to reference files as they will be copied many times.)\n"
00511                  "          h5repack -v -i file_from.a5 -o file_to.a5\n"
00512                  "\n"
00513                  );
00514 
00515   opts->defOpt("h","help",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00516                "Print this message.",
00517                "false");
00518 
00519   opts->defOpt("5","to-tsv5",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00520                "Convert a tsv file to the tsv5 format.",
00521                "false");
00522 
00523   opts->defOpt("tsv","to-tsv",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00524                "Convert a tsv file to the tsv5 format.",
00525                "false");
00526 
00527   opts->defOpt("","append",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00528                "Append to an existing a5 file.",
00529                "false");
00530 
00531   opts->defOpt("","metadata",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00532                "Copy the metadata ('#%' lines) to the tsv5 file.",
00533                "true");
00534 
00535   opts->defOpt("o","output",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00536                "The name of the output file.",
00537                "");
00538 
00539   opts->defOpt("p","precision",PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00540                "The text output precision..",
00541                "6");
00542 
00543   opts->defOpt("","internal-name",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00544                "Selects the name of the File5_Tsv "
00545                "when converting tsv files. IE 'CN5/CN5.calls'.",
00546                "");
00547   opts->defOpt("i","file-name",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00548                "The file name to read from.",
00549                "");
00550 
00551   //
00552   opts->defOpt("mn","matrix-file",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00553                "Create a matrix in this file.",
00554                "");
00555   opts->defOpt("ms","matrix-size",PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00556                "Create a matrix of this size.",
00557                "10");
00558   //
00559   opts->defOpt("vf","vector-file",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00560                "Create a vector in this file.",
00561                "");
00562   opts->defOpt("vn","vector-name",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00563                "Vector name to create or dump",
00564                "vector1");
00565   opts->defOpt("dvf","dump-vector-file",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00566                "Dump the vector in this file.",
00567                "");
00568   //
00569   opts->defOpt("gtf","gen-test-file",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00570                "Generate a test file.",
00571                "");
00572   opts->defOpt("gtfs","gen-test-file-size",PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00573                "Size of the test file to generate.",
00574                "1000");
00575   opts->defOpt("gtfl","gen-test-file-levels",PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00576                "Number of levels to generate.  (1 or more.)",
00577                "1");
00578   opts->defOpt("gtf-s","gen-test-str-cols",PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00579                "",
00580                "10");
00581   opts->defOpt("gtf-i","gen-test-int-cols",PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00582                "",
00583                "10");
00584   opts->defOpt("gtf-d","gen-test-double-cols",PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00585                "",
00586                "10");
00587 
00588   //
00589   opts->defOpt("","find-val",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00590                "Value to find",
00591                "");
00592   opts->defOpt("","find-col",PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00593                "Column to search when finding.",
00594                "");
00595   //
00596   opts->defOpt("lc","line-count",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00597                "Count the lines in a Tsv5 File.",
00598                "false");
00599 }
00600 
00601 int main(int argc, const char* argv[]) {
00602   try {
00603     PgOptions* opts;
00604 
00605     // Create our option parser, define the options and parse.
00606     opts = new PgOptions;
00607     define_aptfile5util_options(opts);
00608     opts->parseArgv(argv);
00609 
00610     // Print our help message if necessary.
00611     if (opts->getBool("help")) {
00612       opts->usage();
00613     }
00614 
00615     //
00616     else if ((opts->get("find-val")!="")||(opts->get("find-col")!="")) {
00617       if (opts->get("find-val")=="") {
00618         Err::errAbort("'--find-val' must be set.");
00619       }
00620       if (opts->get("find-col")=="") {
00621         Err::errAbort("'--find-col' must be set.");
00622       }
00623       //
00624       find_data(opts->get("file-name"),opts->get("internal-name"),opts->get("find-col"),opts->get("find-val"));
00625     }
00626 
00627     //
00628     else if (opts->get("gen-test-file")!="") {
00629       std::string file_name=opts->get("gen-test-file");
00630       int num_rows=opts->getInt("gen-test-file-size");
00631       int num_levels=opts->getInt("gen-test-file-levels");
00632       generate_test_file(file_name,
00633                          num_rows,
00634                          num_levels,
00635                          opts->getInt("gen-test-str-cols"),
00636                          opts->getInt("gen-test-int-cols"),
00637                          opts->getInt("gen-test-double-cols"));
00638     }
00639 
00640     //
00641     else if (opts->getBool("to-tsv5")) {
00642       bool do_metadata=opts->getBool("metadata");
00643       bool do_append=opts->getBool("append");
00644       // have to have an output name.
00645       std::string file5_out=opts->get("output");
00646       if (file5_out=="") {
00647         Err::errAbort("we need an ouput file5.");
00648       }
00649       std::string internal_name=opts->get("internal-name");
00650       if (internal_name!="") {
00651         // If a name is given, we can only import one file,
00652         // otherwise we would be overwriting it.
00653         if (opts->getArgCount()!=1) {
00654           Err::errAbort("can only have one input tsv when using --internal-name.");
00655         }
00656         std::string tsv_file_in=opts->getArg(0);
00657         TsvToTsv5_convert(tsv_file_in,
00658                           file5_out,
00659                           internal_name,
00660                           do_metadata,
00661                           do_append);
00662       }
00663       else {
00664         // we have a bunch-o-tsvfiles and we will
00665         affx::TsvFile tmp_tsv_file;
00666         std::string tsv_file_in;
00667         for (int i=0;i<opts->getArgCount();i++) {
00668           tsv_file_in=opts->getArg(i);
00669           // peek inside for the internal name.
00670           tmp_tsv_file.open(tsv_file_in);
00671           if (tmp_tsv_file.getHeader(FILE5_TSVMETA_PREFIX"-internalname",internal_name)!=affx::TSV_OK) {
00672             Err::errAbort("Didnt find "FILE5_TSVMETA_PREFIX"-internalname header in '"+tsv_file_in+"'");
00673           }
00674           tmp_tsv_file.close();
00675           //
00676           TsvToTsv5_convert(tsv_file_in,
00677                             file5_out,
00678                             internal_name,
00679                             opts->getBool("metadata"),
00680                             true);
00681         }
00682       }
00683     }
00684     
00685     //
00686     else if (opts->getBool("to-tsv")) {
00687       std::string tsv_name=opts->get("internal-name");
00688       if (tsv_name=="") {
00689         printf("Must have --internal-name=NAME with --to-tsv5. Use '--help' for an example.");
00690       }
00691       if (opts->get("output")!="") {
00692         if (opts->getArgCount()==0) {
00693           Err::errAbort("Must supply one or more input files. Use '--help' for an example.");
00694         }
00695         std::string file_in=opts->getArg(0);
00696         std::string file_out=opts->get("output");
00697         Tsv5ToTsv_convert(file_in,tsv_name,file_out,opts->getInt("precision"));
00698       }
00699       else {
00700         for (int i=0;i<opts->getArgCount();i++) {
00701           std::string file_in=opts->getArg(i);
00702           std::string file_out=file_in+".tsv";
00703           Tsv5ToTsv_convert(file_in,tsv_name,file_out,opts->getInt("precision"));
00704         }
00705       }
00706     }
00707 
00708     else if (opts->getBool("line-count")) {
00709       int lineCount;
00710       if ((opts->get("file-name")=="") || (opts->get("tsv-name")=="")) {
00711         Err::errAbort("Need file and tsv name.");
00712       }
00713       lineCount=affx::File5_Tsv::getFileTsvLineCount(opts->get("file-name"),
00714                                                      opts->get("tsv-name"));
00715       printf("%d\n",lineCount);
00716     }
00717 
00718     // no args, print help.
00719     else {
00720       opts->usage();
00721     }
00722     
00723     //
00724     delete opts;
00725     return 0;
00726   }
00727   catch (...) {
00728     Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00729   }
00730   return 1;
00731 }
